Package soot.jimple.infoflow.data

Class SourceContextAndPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.SourceContext
      • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.SourceContextAndPath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    public class SourceContextAndPath
extends SourceContext
implements Cloneable
    Extension of SourceContext that also allows a paths from the source to the current statement to be stored
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

      • extendPath

        public SourceContextAndPath extendPath​(SourceContextAndPath other)
        Extends the taint propagation path of THIS with the additional abstractions from OTHER
        Parameters:
        other - longer taint propagation path
        Returns:
        The new taint propagation path

      • extendPath

        public SourceContextAndPath extendPath​(Abstraction abs)
        Extends the taint propagation path with the given abstraction
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction to put on the taint propagation path
        Returns:
        The new taint propagation path If this path would contain a loop, null is returned instead of the looping path.

      • extendPath

        public SourceContextAndPath extendPath​(Abstraction abs,
                                       InfoflowConfiguration config)
        Extends the taint propagation path with the given abstraction
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction to put on the taint propagation path
        config - The configuration for constructing taint propagation paths
        Returns:
        The new taint propagation path. If this path would contain a loop, null is returned instead of the looping path.

      • popTopCallStackItem

        public heros.solver.Pair<SourceContextAndPath,​soot.jimple.Stmt> popTopCallStackItem()
        Pops the top item off the call stack.
        Returns:
        The new SourceContextAndPath object as the first element of the pair and the call stack item that was popped off as the second element. If there is no call stack, null is returned.

      • isCallStackEmpty

        public boolean isCallStackEmpty()
        Gets whether the current call stack is empty, i.e., the path is in the method from which it originated
        Returns:
        True if the call stack is empty, otherwise false
